 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָחַשׁ‎</span> **verb** only **Pi\`el** ***practise divination, divine, observe signs*** (denominative from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָהָשׁ‎</span> according to [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>Zeitschr. f. Völkerpsychol. i (1860), 413</sup> [[BDB#Bau|Bau]]<sup>Semitic Rel. i. 287</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 188</sup> [[BDB#Gerber|Gerber]]<sup>Verb. Denom. 29</sup>; otherwise [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>Skizzen iii. 147</sup> [[BDB#Me|Mei]]<sup>Chrest. Targ. 8.</sup> see [[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>ES 48</sup> (against him see [[BDB#Sta|Sta]]<sup>ThLz April 28, 1894, 235</sup>); chief difficulty is that Aramaic, which has <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַחֵשׁ‎</span>, has no <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָחָשׁ‎</span> compare [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>JPh.xiv. 115</sup>; — Late Hebrew Qal Participle <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוֺחֵשׁ‎</span>, and Pi\`el; Aramaic Pa\`el <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַחֵשׁ‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, all = ***divine, learn by omens***; perhaps compare also Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be unlucky*** [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>2775</sup> compare [[BDB#Me|Mei]]<sup>1.c</sup>); — ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנִחֵשׁ‎</span> [[2Kgs.21.6|2Kgs 21:6]]; [[2Chr.33.6|2Chr 33:6]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִחַ֫שְׁתִּי‎</span> [[Gen.30.27|Gen 30:27]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְגַחֵשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.44.5|Gen 44:5]]; [[Gen.44.15|Gen 44:15]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְנַחֲשׁוּ‎</span> [[1Kgs.20.33|1Kgs 20:33]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַחָ֑שׁוּ‎</span> [[2Kgs.17.17|2Kgs 17:17]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַחֲשׁוּ‎</span> [[Lev.19.26|Lev 19:26]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַחֵשׁ‎</span>[[1Kgs.20.33|1Kgs 20:33]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְנַחֵשׁ‎</span> [[Deut.18.10|Deut 18:10]] (compare especially [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>JPhoenician xiv. .113 ff.</sup>); — 

**1.** ***practise divination*** [[Gen.44.5|Gen 44:5]] ([[BDB#J|J]]; by means of cup, i.e. by hydromancy), with implied power to learn secret things v[[Gen.44.15|Gen 44:15]] condemned by prophetic writer [[2Kgs.21.6|2Kgs 21:6]] = [[2Chr.33.6|2Chr 33:6]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺנֵן וְעָשָׂח אוֺב‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיִדְּעֹנִים‎</span>), [[2Kgs.17.17|2Kgs 17:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּקְסְמוּ קְסָמִים‎</span>); forbidden in [[BDB#D|D]] and H: [[Deut.18.10|Deut 18:10]] ( + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֹסֵם קְסָמִים מְעוֺנֵן וּמְכַשֵּׁף‎</span>), [[Lev.19.26|Lev 19:26]] ([[BDB#H|H]]; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּעוֺנֵנ֑וּ‎</span>). 

**2.** ***observe the signs or omens*** [[Gen.30.27|Gen 30:27]] (j); so probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְנַחֲשׁוּ‎</span> [[1Kgs.20.33|1Kgs 20:33]] now the men ***were observing the signs***.
